newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Unisource says in no hurry to replace Telefonica.
newsitem.headline: Unisource says in no hurry to replace Telefonica.

text.p: Unisource said on Friday it was in no rush to replace Telefonica of Spain after asking it to quit the four-nation grouping of telecoms carriers.

"We don't exclude the entrance of a fourth partner. We will be carefully selecting the opportunities. There have been many parties in the past who have shown interest in joining us but we're absolutely not going to hurry," said Ben Verwaayen, head of Koninklijke PTT Nederland NV's telecom arm.
Unisource groups KPN, Telia of Sweden, Swiss Telecom PTT and Telefonica. Telefonica earlier on Friday formed a strategic alliance with a rival British/U.S. communications grouping.
Under the deal Telefonica, MCI Communications and British Telecommunications Plc formed an alliance spanning three continents.
Unisource, which has a 60/40 pan-European communications alliance with AT&T Corp called AT&T Unisource, promptly asked Telefonica to leave.

Verwaayen, chairman of the AT&T Unisource supervisory board and speaking on behalf of the Unisource shareholders, declined to comment on media speculation that Italy's Societa Finanziaria Telefonica per Azioni SpA (STET ) could join Unisource.

"We will take a careful look at the situation, see what is necessary and what it brings to the benefits of Unisource and AT&T Unisource. We've spoken to a lot of parties but I'm not going to comment on the imagined candidates that people bring to me," said Verwaayen in a telephone interview. -- Keiron Henderson, Amsterdam Newsroom +31 20 504 5000
